cjdelisle - (18:57): npm: It's a problem with a panel if I'm not mistaken, It should be fixable by changing <platform.panels.version>1.38</platform.panels.version> to <platform.panels.version>1.37</platform.panels.version> in xwiki-enterprise-2.4/pom.xml  I'm running the tests now to see if that fixes the problem.  
MartinCleaver joined #xwiki at 18:57  
MartinCleaver left at 18:57 (Excess Flood  
cjdelisle - (18:58): Ouch, looks like MartinCleaver is having some trouble with CTCP version floods.  
MartinCleaver joined #xwiki at 18:58  
MartinCleaver left at 18:58 (Excess Flood  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 19:54  
lucaa left at 20:26 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
npm - (20:41): cjdelisle: so the fix would then involve making the change to existing ./META-INF/maven/com.xpn.xwiki.products/xwiki-enterprise-web/pom.xml ?  
cjdelisle - (20:42): it's the xwiki-enterprise-2.4/pom.xml  
npm - (20:42): oh, in the xar.  
cjdelisle - (20:43): No, in the maven repository.  
npm - (20:43): so i could, being the hacker, unpack the xar and correct it, then repack and import?  
cjdelisle - (20:43): err the svn repo.  
cjdelisle - (20:44): Theoretically yes but it would probably be easier to correct the pom file and build.  
npm - (20:44): depends on whether maven cache has been updated recently :-)  
cjdelisle - (20:46): I just did the build myself and I'm running the tests now.  
cjdelisle - (20:52): oops just broke a test, trying to type and the window pops up.  
cjdelisle - (20:52): you could but you'd have to set up your own maven project.  
cjdelisle - (20:57): hmm I never knew an image could be base64 encoded in a webpage.  
cjdelisle - (20:58): "data:image/jpeg;base64"  
npm - (20:58): sounds like a good performance booster  
npm - (20:59): assuming you can combine datas for multiple images into html for main doc  
cjdelisle - (21:00): Always wondered why the google video thumbnails never showed up when google was noscripted.  
cjdelisle - (21:00): I guess javascript unpacks it and creates the image.  
npm - (21:00): i was about to mention that the technique would be good for js apps  
npm - (21:01): otherwise how would these images be "cached"  
npm - (21:01): if not per page  
cjdelisle - (21:04): I was reading about evercookies which were able to cache data in png images.  
cjdelisle - (21:04): Basically post data to the server, it returns same data as a png. request same png with no data posted, server sends a "not modified" and it loads from the cache.  
cjdelisle - (21:05): Then javascript could load data from the png file.  
npm - (21:33): if people don't want that feature of they web, they should use lynx or w3 in emacs :-)  
cjdelisle - (21:35): "don't want that feature of they web" you mean if they don't want to be tracked?  
cjdelisle - (21:39): v0.02  
cjdelisle - (22:14): I have an unofficial build here, I'm doing a little manual testing first, I can post the xar if you want it.  
cjdelisle - (22:35): npm: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/XWiki/Caleb\_James\_DeLisle/xwiki%2Denterprise%2D2.4.2%2D2%2Dunofficial.xar   This seems to fix the panel parent issue.  
cjdelisle - (22:36): Keep in mind, it's unofficial. I'm not the release manager.  
npm - (22:40): sweet! thanks  
npm - (22:42): and what would i look for for signs of success? or is the parent panel issue a fundamental showstopper  
cjdelisle - (22:44): I just checked it against the official release, the only (known) problem with the official was when you edited a page, you couldn't set the parent from the panel.  
cjdelisle - (22:45): That is apparently fixed, I also random checked some other stuff which breaks easily, no signs of trouble.  
cjdelisle - (22:46): All of the ui-tests pass (2 have problems but tinkering with the tests made them work.)  
npm - (22:50): will test on other wikis in vwiki setup, but this one worked so far  
npm left at 23:05 (Read error: Operation timed out
